Description: The study site was 20 m times 20 m plot situated at ca. 320 m a. s. l. in a subtropical evergreen broadleaf forest. Stand density was 2900 trees/ha. Thriteen sample trees were chosen from the plot taking tree species and DBH distribution into consideration

column5: and T. Hiura conducted formal search of reference databases and digitized raw data from Kawanabe (1977). Based on this reference
column6: meta data was also created by M. Ishihara. Species name and family names were converted by M. Ishihara according to the following references: Satake Y
column7: Hara H (1989a) Wild flower of Japan Woody plants I (in Japanese). Heibonsha
column9: Hara H (1989b) Wild flower of Japan Woody plants II (in Japanese). Heibonsha
